Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "perennials" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Daffodils are flowers that blossom in the spring. In order to grow daffodils, you first need to plant their bulbs in the ground in the fall. Once you have planted the daffodil bulbs, you can enjoy the daffodils for many spring seasons to come. They are considered perennials. Daffodils are usually a shade of yellow, and tend to have lots of greenery that starts at the base of the plant.
choices: something that comes back again and again

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "autumn" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: If you live in a climate where the leaves change color and fall in the autumn, it is important to rake up the leaves before the winter comes. If you do not get the leaves picked up before the snow and winter comes, it can be a big, wet mess in the spring. It is also important to make sure to clear leaves out of the gutters so that water can flow freely.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "freshwater" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Rivers are bodies of moving water. They have a current which moves the water. Rivers can be very long, and have areas where the current is very fast, and other areas where the current is slow. Rivers are fed by smaller bodies of water called streams. Rivers are composed of freshwater, and are home to many plant and fish species. They eventually reach the ocean.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "chilly" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: The desert is a very dry place where it rarely rains. Plants and animals that live in the desert have special ways to save water. Cactus plants store water in their thick stems. The desert can be very hot during the day, but it gets quite chilly at night when the sun goes down.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "fluffy" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Clouds are made of tiny water droplets that float in the sky. When clouds get very dark and heavy with water, they are ready to release rain. Some clouds are white and fluffy, looking like cotton balls floating above us. These clouds usually mean nice weather.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "recedes" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: The ocean water moves in and out along the beach every day. When the water comes up high on the sand, it is called high tide. When the water goes back out and recedes, you can see more of the beach and find seashells in the sand.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "transformation" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Butterflies start their lives as caterpillars. The caterpillar eats many leaves to grow big and strong. Then it forms a shell around itself called a cocoon. Inside the cocoon, the caterpillar goes through a transformation and becomes a beautiful butterfly with colorful wings.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "towering" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Sunflowers are tall plants with big yellow flowers. They are called sunflowers because the flower heads turn to follow the sun across the sky. Sunflowers can grow to be very towering, sometimes reaching over six feet tall, which is taller than most grown-ups!

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "crumbly" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Building sandcastles at the beach is a fun activity. You need wet sand that sticks together. Dry sand is too crumbly and falls apart easily. You can use buckets and shovels to shape the sand into towers and walls.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "creatures" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Tide pools are small pools of ocean water left behind when the tide goes out. Many sea creatures live in tide pools, including starfish, crabs, and small fish. You can observe them, but it is important not to touch or disturb them.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "spiral" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: When you walk along the beach, you might find seashells in the sand. Seashells are the hard outer coverings that once protected soft sea animals. Some shells are spiral, twisting around in a circular pattern like a slide at the playground.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "powerful" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Ocean waves are created by wind blowing across the water. Some waves are small and gentle, while others are large and powerful. Surfers wait for big, strong waves to ride on their surfboards.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "apply" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: When you spend time at the beach, it is important to wear sunscreen. The sun's rays can burn your skin if you are not protected. You should apply sunscreen by rubbing it all over your skin before going outside, and ask a grown-up to help with your back.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "social" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Dolphins are smart animals that live in the ocean. They breathe air like we do and must come to the surface to breathe. Dolphins are very social and like to swim together in groups called pods. They communicate with each other using clicks and whistles.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "temperature" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: The refrigerator is an important appliance in the kitchen. It keeps food cold so it stays fresh longer. Fruits, vegetables, and drinks are stored inside. The temperature inside the refrigerator is much colder than the rest of the kitchen.
choices: how hot or cold something is

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "remove" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: On laundry day, dirty clothes go into the washing machine. The machine fills with water and soap, then spins to clean the clothes. After washing, the clothes are wet and need to go in the dryer. The dryer uses warm air to remove the water from the clothes so they are dry and ready to wear.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "organized" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: It feels good to have a clean room. When toys and books are put away in their proper places, the room looks organized. You can find things easily when everything has a spot where it belongs.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "bubbles" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Taking a bath helps you get clean. You fill the bathtub with warm water and add some soap. The soap makes bubbles that are round and float on top of the water. Bath time can be fun and relaxing.
choices: round balls of air covered in soap

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "suctions" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: A vacuum cleaner helps keep floors clean. It suctions up dirt, dust, and crumbs from the carpet and floor. The machine makes a loud noise as it pulls the tiny bits of dirt inside.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "warmth" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: On cold days, it feels nice to wrap up in a soft blanket. Blankets provide warmth and help you feel comfortable. You might use a blanket while watching television or reading a book on the couch.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "combines" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Grown-ups can make smoothies by putting fruit in a blender. They add bananas, strawberries, and orange juice. The blender spins very fast and combines all the ingredients together until the drink is smooth and ready to enjoy.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "remove" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Oranges have a thick outer skin that protects the fruit inside. Before eating an orange, you need to remove the peel by pulling it off with your fingers. The sweet, juicy fruit is inside waiting to be eaten.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "nutritious" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Vegetables are healthy foods that help our bodies grow strong. Cucumbers, bell peppers, and carrots are nutritious foods, meaning they are full of vitamins and good things our bodies need.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "energy" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Breakfast is the first meal of the day. Eating breakfast gives you energy to start your morning. Foods like oatmeal, fruit, and toast help wake up your body and brain so you can learn and play.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "spread" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: A peanut butter and jelly sandwich is a popular lunch. You spread the peanut butter on one slice of bread by moving your spoon back and forth until it covers the whole surface. Then you add jelly to the other slice.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "short" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Bunnies are soft, furry animals with long ears. They like to eat vegetables like carrots and lettuce. Bunnies move by hopping, which means they jump with both back legs at the same time. Their fluffy tails are very short, much smaller than their long ears.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "breathe" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Pet fish live in tanks filled with water. The water must stay clean and at the right temperature. Fish have special body parts called gills that help them breathe underwater by taking in oxygen from the water.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "companions" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Dogs and cats are popular pets that many families have at home. Dogs often bark to communicate, while cats meow. Both animals can be trained and make loyal companions, which means they are friends who stay by your side.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "clean" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: It is important to brush your teeth every morning and every night. Brushing removes tiny bits of food and keeps your teeth healthy. You should brush for two minutes to make sure your teeth are completely clean, with no food or germs left behind.

Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.question: What does "appropriate" mean?
Context Clues - Define Word In Paragraph.paragraph: Every morning, you get dressed for the day. You pick out clothes from your closet and dresser. It is important to wear clothes that are appropriate for the weather, meaning they are right for how hot or cold it is outside.

Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.paragraph: When the trash can is full, it's time to empty it. Tie the _________ closed and carry it outside. Put it in the big trash bin for pickup day.

Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.question: Fill in the blank.
Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.paragraph: Plants need water to live and grow. Check the soil to see if it is dry. If it is, pour water into the _________ at the base of the plant.

Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.question: Fill in the blank.
Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.paragraph: Birds are fun to watch. Some birds fly south for the winter to stay warm. They travel in groups called _________. In spring, they return home.

Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.question: Fill in the blank.
Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.paragraph: To grow a plant, start with seeds. Dig a small hole in the dirt and place the seed inside. Cover it with _________ and water it regularly.

Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.question: Fill in the blank.
Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.paragraph: When it rains, water falls from the clouds. If you go outside, wear boots and carry an _________. This will help keep you dry.

Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.question: Fill in the blank.
Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.paragraph: On sunny days, the sun shines brightly. It can make you feel hot and thirsty. Wear _________ to protect your eyes from the bright light.

Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.question: Fill in the blank.
Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.paragraph: In autumn, leaves change colors. They turn red, orange, and yellow. When they fall from the trees, you can _________ them into big piles and jump in.

Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.question: Fill in the blank.
Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.paragraph: Making friends starts with being kind. Smile and say hello to new people. Ask them questions and _________ to what they say. Everyone likes to feel heard.

Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.question: Fill in the blank.
Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.paragraph: Everyone makes mistakes sometimes. When you hurt someone's feelings, say you are _________. This shows you care and helps fix the problem.

Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.question: Fill in the blank.
Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.paragraph: Sharing is an important skill. When you share your toys, others will want to _________ with you too. Taking turns makes playtime fun for everyone.

Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.question: Fill in the blank.
Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.paragraph: There are many things that can make you happy. Spending time with family, playing games, and learning new things can all bring _________. What makes you smile?

Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.question: Fill in the blank.
Context Clues In Short Paragraphs.paragraph: Sometimes you have to wait for things you want. This is called being patient. It can be hard, but good things often come to those who _________.
